sections.heading: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Workforce Direct Care Expansion Act.
sections.text: Short title. This Act may be cited as the Workforce Direct Care Expansion Act.

sections.heading: The Behavioral Health Administrative Burden Task Force.
sections.text: The Behavioral Health Administrative Burden Task Force.

sections.heading: Membership. The Task Force shall be chaired by Illinois' Chief Behavioral Health Officer or the Officer's designee
sections.text: The chair of the Task Force may designate a nongovernmental entity or entities to provide pro bono administrative support to the Task Force. Except as otherwise provided in this Sectio

sections.heading: Meetings. Beginning no later than 6 months after the effective date of this Act, the Task Force shall meet monthly, or additionally as needed, to conduct its business
sections.text: Members of the Task Force shall serve without compensation but may receive reimbursement for necessary expenses.

sections.heading: Administrative burden reduction plan
sections.text: The Task Force shall, within one year after its first meeting, prepare an administrative burden reduction plan, which shall include short-term and long-term policy recommendations aimed at reducing duplicative, unnecessary, or redundant requirements placed on be

sections.heading: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
sections.text: Effective date. This Act takes effect upon becoming law.
